thread.section_title: Diesel Ops Reviews | Customer Service Reviews of Diesel Ops | dieselops.com
thread.title: Regular Joe
thread.title_full: Diesel Ops reviewed by Regular Joe

author: Regular Joe
title: Regular Joe
text: The products were good quality and came as expected. At the time of the order Diesel Ops sent me the Installation Instructions so I could read them while I was waiting for the parts to ship to me. Not much for Instructions on removing the 8 exhaust sensors but you can watch a video on YouTube. Make sure you use lots of penetrating oil/spray on the lower EGR bolts for the long EGR pipe. These bolts will break on you! I started spraying them a week ahead of time and I still had to slowly work them back and forth with spraying in between working the bolts out and back in. I recommend slowly working these bolts before your parts arrive so you Installation will go faster. My bolts were still knurled after taking it slow with them. Use bolts from a different location when you put the new plate on. (The other bolts will have better threads left on them.) My only complaint is the smaller cooler lines come with a barb but no hose clamps and the factory uses a crimped clamp that is not reusable. Not a big deal if you have an Auto Parts store near you but I would recommend getting some ahead of time. You'll have lots of fun with the lower radiator hose connection. Take out the inner fender and have a Buddy on stand to help for a few minutes. The end product is very impressive and has a great sound with good turbo howl.
